responsibilities: Provide individual psychotherapy services to child, adolescent, and adult clients in a private practice setting
Complete comprehensive integrative psychological evaluations using cognitive ability, academic achievement, and objective personality measures

supervisedClinicalExperience.organization: Clay City Center for Family Medicine
responsibilities: Provided individual psychotherapy services to child, adolescent, and adult clients in an integrated primary care setting

Prepared integrative psychological reports, created treatment plans, and maintained progress notes utilizing an electronic medical record system

responsibilities: Provide weekly peer supervision to second-year doctoral students in their first year of clinical practicum
Review session recordings, progress notes, and clinical writing to support development in intervention, documentation, and ethical decision-making
Facilitate reflective case discussions and offer formative feedback on clinical skills and professional identity
Participate in biweekly group supervision with other peer supervisors to strengthen supervisory practices and align with program expectations
Supervised undergraduate music therapy students leading one group session per week in an outpatient psychiatric setting
Provided weekly individual supervision focused on session planning, therapeutic use of music, and clinical documentation
Completed formal evaluations and collaborated with university faculty to assess student competencies and progress

specialProjects: Co-developed adolescent IOP policies, procedures, safety protocols, and treatment structure in collaboration with supervisors and hospital administration

responsibilities: Completed 1,040-hour internship providing music therapy to adults and older adults on acute inpatient psychiatric units

researchExperience.title: Factors Contributing to Music Performance Anxiety Among College Musicians
researchExperience.status: Proposal Defended Aug 2025; IRB Approval Feb 2025
description: Designed a quantitative study testing associations between childhood temperament, anxiety symptoms, and music performance anxiety in college musicians
Secured IRB approval and began participant recruitment and data collection in Spring 2025 after obtaining dissertation committee approval
Anticipate completing data analysis in spring of 2026
Anticipate defending final dissertation in summer of 2026

researchExperience.title: ISU Psychomusicology Lab
description: Conducted qualitative and quantitative data analysis on studies examining sad music listening, rumination, and social comparison

Synthesized relevant literature to inform theoretical framing and integration of qualitative findings

researchExperience.title: A Mindfulness-Based Music Intervention to Decrease Anxiety and Depression in Cancer Patients
researchExperience.institution: Sylvester Comprehensive Cancer Center, University of Miami
description: Designed and implemented a novel music-based mindfulness protocol for adults undergoing chemotherapy in inpatient and outpatient oncology units
Provided 120 client-contact hours delivering the intervention to individuals experiencing cancer-related distress
Completed a comprehensive project report including literature review, intervention rationale, and clinical protocol manual
Successfully defended project proposal and final report before graduate faculty committee
Assisted in participant recruitment and scoring of the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator
Conducted behavioral coding and analysis of infant and toddler movement responses to music from video-recorded sessions
Performed data entry and supported organization of audiovisual materials for lab-based developmental music research
